display_asset.caption: The crew of the U.S.S. Conestoga, at San Diego, circa early 1921.
display_asset.credit: U.S. Naval History and Heritage Command, via Reuters

summaries.body: The U.S.S. Conestoga, a Navy tugboat that disappeared in 1921, has been found in shark-infested waters about 30 miles west of San Francisco.

display_asset.caption: Tourists on Wednesday along Obispo Boulevard, a street in central Havana known for restaurants, live music, bars and souvenir shops.
display_asset.credit: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times

summaries.body: The huge increase in American travel to Cuba is leading to shortages in food, gas and hotel rooms, plus a sharp rise in prices that will only steepen.

display_asset.caption: Lebanese models dressed as Batman and Superman on the rooftop of a building during a photography session in Beirut on Wednesday.

summaries.body: Critics have ripped apart "Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice," but that might not keep die-hard fans from buying tickets.

display_asset.caption: Lee Bo, center, speaking with reporters near his home in Hong Kong on Friday. Mr. Lee was one of five people associated with Mighty Current Media to have disappeared, only to emerge in mainland China, apparently in detention.

summaries.body: One day after the once-missing Hong Kong bookseller, Lee Bo, reappeared in Hong Kong, local news media reported that he had been driven back to mainland China.

display_asset.caption: The Geneseo hockey team honored Matthew Hutchinson with a chant of “One, two, three, Hutch.”

summaries.body: The Geneseo hockey team has reached the Division III Final Four while grieving two deaths in an apparent double murder/suicide.
Contrary to what the Internet may have you believe, it's baby boomers — not millennials — who are the most addicted to their smartphones, a Nielsen survey found.

display_asset.caption: U Kyaw Win, who is expected to be the new minister of finance and planning, said he earned a master’s degree and a doctorate from Brooklyn Park University. But that institution has been identified as part of a network of websites run by a Pakistan-based company that has sold millions of dollars in fake diplomas.

summaries.body: Dubious academic degrees of two officials have raised questions about the credibility of Myanmar’s new government before it comes to power next week.

display_asset.caption: Roger Federer practicing at the Miami Open on Thursday.

summaries.body: Back from a knee injury, the tennis superstar Roger Federer caught up by talking to reporters about doping, gender equity and other topics.
A start-up in Minnesota is developing a two-shot pistol that folds up to resemble a smartphone. The concealed weapon will be available for sale in mid-2016 and retail for $395.

display_asset.caption: Alex Rodriguez speaking with reporters at the Yankees’ camp. He avoided straight answers about his possible retirement.

summaries.body: A day after confusing reports surfaced about his possible retirement, Alex Rodriguez played coy with reporters and did little to clarify the situation.

display_asset.caption: A rendering of a proposed redevelopment of La Guardia Airport, in Queens.

summaries.body: In a move totaling billions, the Port Authority voted to build a bus complex in Midtown Manhattan and update La Guardia and Newark Liberty International Airports.

display_asset.caption: Sarah McDaniel on the cover of Playboy magazine. Playboy now makes most of its money from licensing its ubiquitous brand and logo across the world.

summaries.body: Playboy Enterprises is said to be exploring a sale. When the iconic Playboy Mansion went up for sale, it prompted interest from potential buyers of the entire company.

display_asset.caption: Donald J. Trump at Mar-a-Lago in Palm Beach, Fla., in March.
display_asset.credit: Eric Thayer for The New York Times

summaries.body: Endorsements have piled up as the Republican and Democratic fields have been whittled. Have you been paying attention? Take the presidential endorsement quiz.

display_asset.caption: James Meyers, who was handcuffed over the VHS tape.

summaries.body: Fourteen years ago, a man rented a VHS videotape (Google it) of the movie “Freddy Got Fingered.” He failed to return it. This week he was arrested, and handcuffed.

display_asset.caption: The grave of William Shakespeare inside Holy Trinity Church in Stratford-upon-Avon.

summaries.body: Alas, poor William Shakespeare. Where does his skull rest? Researchers have uncovered evidence that, they say, indicates his skull was stolen from his grave in 1794.

display_asset.caption: Tay’s Twitter account. The bot was developed by Microsoft’s technology and research and Bing teams.

summaries.body: In less than 24 hours after going live, a Microsoft-created Twitter bot had to be shut down because it was mimicking the racist and profane language of human users.

With nearly 600,000 car owners in the United States stuck in limbo, Volkswagen missed a court deadline to present a plan to bring its cars into line with clean air rules. A judge gave the company an extension until April 21.

display_asset.caption: Johan Cruyff playing against Argentina in the 1974 World Cup.

summaries.body: Johan Cruyff, the Netherlands' greatest soccer star, whose brash style helped revolutionize the way the game is played, died on Thursday. He was 68.

display_asset.caption: Beyonce with Jay Z, second from right, who announced his plans for the Tidal streaming music service in March 2015 in Manhattan.
display_asset.credit: Sam Hodgson for The New York Times

summaries.body: Revenue from music sales in the U.S. has hovered around $7 billion since 2010, but there have been drastic shifts in listener behavior as streaming services have supplanted CDs and downloads.

display_asset.caption: Sujit Choudhry, who stepped down this month as dean of the law school, remains on the Berkeley faculty. Ms. Sorrell filed a civil suit saying the punishment meted out against him was inadequate.
display_asset.credit: University of California, Berkeley, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A spate of high-profile cases of sexual harassment at the University of California, Berkeley, has tarnished the school's image as a center of social activism.

display_asset.caption: North Carolina lawmakers gathered on the House floor for a special session on Wednesday.

summaries.body: North Carolina legislators passed a bill barring transgender people from bathrooms and locker rooms that do not match the gender on their birth certificates.

display_asset.caption: “I’ve been having bad dreams about her being burned up,” said Donald Little, whose mother was mistakenly cremated.

summaries.body: After a Times article about a funeral home mix-up in which a family eulogized the wrong woman, the son of the woman who was mistakenly cremated has come forward.

display_asset.caption: The idea of replacing New Zealand’s flag has percolated for decades, with new proposals for changing it cropping up every few years.

summaries.body: New Zealand spent two years thinking about a replacement, and judges considered 10,292 options, but in the end the country chose to keep the century-old design of its flag.

display_asset.caption: The president took to the dance floor at a state dinner in Argentina.
display_asset.title: Obama Dances the Tango

summaries.body: At the end of a state dinner with President Mauricio Macri of Argentina, President Obama danced the tango.
The word “O.K.” has now been around for 177 years. It first appeared in The Boston Morning Post on March 23, 1839, to mean “all correct.”

display_asset.caption: Notre Dame’s Matt Farrell, right, said players on his team often competed for one another’s extra tickets.

summaries.body: Bribing teammates with candy? Many N.C.A.A. basketball players turn to bartering — or other methods — to procure tournament tickets for family and friends.
Red numbers are piling up for William A. Ackman. Losses at the pharmaceutical company Valeant have pushed Mr. Ackman's hedge fund down 25 percent for the year.

display_asset.caption: Enrichetta Ravina, an assistant professor of finance, has filed a gender discrimination lawsuit against Columbia University.
display_asset.credit: Sam Hodgson for The New York Times

summaries.body: A Columbia University professor has filed a sexual harassment suit. Enrichetta Ravina said officials belittled her complaints that a colleague made repeated advances.
For the Cuba state dinner, Michelle Obama chose to wear a dress by the Indian-American designer Naeem Khan. Mrs. Obama has often worn his pieces.

display_asset.caption: Alex Rodriguez will turn 41 in July and now says the end is in sight.
display_asset.credit: Jerome Miron/USA Today Sports, via Reuters

summaries.body: The Yankees star Alex Rodriguez says he will retire after the 2017 season. The move, which he announced to ESPN, would come at the end of his current deal.
